events.message: The customer reported an incident involving a collision with another vehicle on a rainy day, causing damage to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' after reviewing the details describing a vehicle collision on public roads.
An agent was assigned to the case to manage communications and guide the customer through the claim process.
The customer received an acknowledgment confirming the claim had been logged successfully and next steps would follow.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and insurance details to proceed with the investigation.
The customer provided all requested documents, including detailed photos and the official police accident report.
The claims team began the investigation to verify the details of the collision and the extent of the damage reported.
Investigation confirmed the collision details and assessed the required repairs for the damaged areas of the vehicle.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount covering repairs and rental car reimbursement during the downtime.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the communication and support.
The claim was officially approved after the customer agreed to the terms of the settlement and repair arrangements.
The settlement payment was issued promptly to the customerâ€™s designated bank account as per the approved claim.
The claim was closed successfully following payment disbursement and confirmation of completed vehicle repairs.
